patterns: Are corona virus and covid-19 different?
Are coronavirus and covid 19 the same?
responses: COVID-19 is a disease caused by the virus type coronavirus.

patterns: Is there a season for covid 19?
responses: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) appears to be temperature-sensitive and, therefore, seasonal.

patterns: Can I have information about coronavirus?
Can you give me details about coronavirus?
Can you tell me about COVID-19?
Can you tell me what coronavirus is?
responses:
COVID-19 is the disease caused by SARS-CoV-2, 
the coronavirus that emerged in December 2019.

patterns: Can you explain how covid 19 started?
Can you explain how the virus started?
Can you explain how the virus came into existance?
How the virus started and when?
Tell me about origin of covid?
responses:
The virus first appeared on a small scale in November 2019 with the first 
large cluster appearing in Wuhan, China in December 2019

patterns: Did coronavirus come from a bat?
Did coronavirus come from a lab?
Did coronavirus come from an animal?
Did coronavirus come from bat soup?
responses:
No, the virus that causes COVID-19 hasn-t been isolated 
from any of the UK-s 17 resident breeding bat species. 
There are no known zoonotic (harmful to humans) coronaviruses found in UK bats. 
In fact the COVID-19 virus hasn-t been isolated from any 
of the world-s 1400+ species of bat.

patterns: Are coronavirus symptoms similar to that of flu?
Are the only symptoms simillar to that of flu?
Are the symptoms same for every patient?
What are the symptoms of covid 19?
responses:
People with COVID-19 have had a wide range of symptoms reported â€“ 
ranging from mild symptoms to severe illness. 
Symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure to the virus. 
Anyone can have mild to severe symptoms.People with these symptoms can have COVID-19:
Fever or chills
Cough
Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
Fatigue
Headache

patterns: Are there any emergency numbers for coronavirus in my area?
Are there any means of contact for COVID 19 patients to reach the authorities?
Can I call my regular physician for coronavirus symptoms?
responses:
In order to assist those with suspected Covid-19 the 
Ministry of Health has established an emergency hotline 1390 for the public 
to obtain free medical advice on symptoms of COVID-19.

patterns: Are masks important during the Covid19 virus outbreak?
Are masks the only option for preventing Covid19?
Can wearing a mask help prevent the spread of the corona virus?
responses:
Face masks combined with other preventive measures, such as 
getting vaccinated, frequent hand-washing and physical distancing, 
can help slow the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19

patterns: How can i avoid getting infected?
How can I be precautionary about corona
How can I keep myself safe
How can I prevent corona virus
How can I prevent from catching the virus?
How can I protect myself against COVID-19?
How can I stay safe during corona virus emergency
responses:
You can lower your chances of getting or spreading the virus by 
taking these steps: 
Wash your hands well and often. 
Use hand sanitizer when you are not near soap and water. 
Try not to touch your face. 
Wear a face mask when you go out. 
Follow your community guidelines for staying home. 
When you do go out in public leave at least 6 feet of space between you 
and others. 
Do not leave your house if you do not feel well. 
Cover your mouth with your elbow when you cough or sneeze, or use a tissue.

patterns: Do we have treatment for the virus?
responses:
At the moment, there is no cure for infection with the coronavirus 
behind the COVID-19 pandemic. 
However, different types of drugs are being tested in human patients for 
their ability to fight off infection or to reduce the severity of disease. 
Examples include an antiviral known as remdesivir, a drug used 
for pancreatic inflammation called camostat mesilate, 
and the therapeutic antibody regeneron. Also, a number 
of vaccines were being developed and investigated for their 
ability to prevent COVID-19

patterns: is corona virus a bio weapon
Is China using covid-19 to take over the world?
responses:
Please refer the below link to learn more about covid-19 related myths 
 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8300139/

patterns: Could you tell me how COVID-19 is spreading?
Can the virus be spread through handshakes
Can one person infect a whole group of people with COVID-19?
Does the corona spread by touch?
responses:
COVID-19 transmits when people breathe in air contaminated by 
 droplets and small airborne particles containing the virus. 
 The risk of breathing these in is highest when people are in close proximity, 
 but they can be inhaled over longer distances, particularly indoors. 
Transmission can also occur if splashed or sprayed with 
 contaminated fluids in the eyes, nose or mouth, and, rarely, 
via contaminated surfaces
